title: The Process Type Foundry announces Maple
content:
—  
We’re pleased to announce the arrival of our latest typeface Maple.  
A distinct departure from our recent releases, Maple is a warm grotesque  
with modern sensibilities and historical influences from the 19th and  
early 20th centuries. Suited for both text and display settings, the  
complete family contains four weights, companion italics, rugged charm  
and ostentatious flair.

Maple is available for license as a complete family, in packages  
containing two weights each, or as single weights. Both Mac and Windows  
purchasers will receive two formats: OpenType (which includes extended  
language support) and traditional PostScript Type 1.

—  
See more of Maple:  
 [http://www.processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/maple/](http://web.archive.org/web/20051127124917/http:/www.processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/maple/)
author: Miss Tiffany : 5 August, 2005 - 12:49pm

comments.content: I used Maple in Interrobang 3 and it set beautifully. The idiosyncrasies didn’t stand out as I had feared. Definitely a great alternative to the other woody grots like Knockout and MT.

_The idiosyncrasies didn’t stand out as I had feared._

We _LOVE_ idiosyncrasies! :-D
I guess I’m not the only one to think that Process is one of the most interesting new foundries (?)

Wow, that’s really great. It’s like wood type on steroids…

By the way, Stephen, I’m looking forward to using _woody grot_ in a sentence.

I like it too, altough it looks much like storm’s stuff, it still has the Process touch and it’s not so spicy.

Héctor
